interfaceSections.description: The Gutenberg editor is divided into three main sections

sections.contentArea: The main editing canvas where you create and arrange blocks
sections.leftSidebar: Contains the Inserter (blocks/patterns) and List View for navigating nested content
sections.rightSidebar: Settings sidebar for configuring the selected block or document properties

addingBlocks.description: Multiple ways to add blocks to the editor

methods.name: Inserter Button
steps: Click the + button in the top-left toolbar

methods.name: Quick Inserter
steps: Click the + button that appears between blocks or in empty paragraphs
methods.tip: Fastest for adding blocks between existing content

methods.name: Slash Command
steps: In an empty paragraph, type / followed by block name
methods.tip: Keyboard users' favorite - no mouse needed

listView.description: Navigate and organize nested blocks using List View
usage: Open List View from the toolbar (three horizontal lines icon)
See hierarchical structure of all blocks on the page
Click any block in List View to select it in the editor
Drag blocks in List View to reorder them
Expand containers to see nested blocks inside
bestPractices: Use List View when working with deeply nested content
Rename Group blocks to describe their purpose
Use List View to select parent containers that are hard to click

blockToolbar.description: The toolbar that appears above a selected block
features: Transform block to different type (click block icon)
Drag handle to move block by dragging
More options menu (three dots) for additional actions

designPatterns.description: Pre-made layouts of grouped blocks to accelerate design

types.themePatterns: Patterns bundled with your theme, organized by category
types.syncedPatterns: Patterns you create that update everywhere when edited (purple icon)
types.unsyncedPatterns: Patterns you create that are independent copies
types.templateParts: Reusable header, footer, and other structural elements

insertPattern: Modify content and styling to fit your needs
createSyncedPattern: Select the blocks you want to save as a pattern
Click More options (three dots) in toolbar
Pattern will now update everywhere when edited

nestingBestPractices.description: Best practices for creating complex layouts with nested blocks
guidelines: Use container blocks to group related content together
Always use List View when working with nested structures
Rename Group blocks to describe their purpose (e.g., 'Testimonial Section')
When changing container width, first deselect 'Inner blocks use content width'
Add padding to container blocks, not individual nested blocks

core/paragraph.name: Paragraph
core/paragraph.description: Start with the basic building block of all narrative.

core/heading.name: Heading
core/heading.description: Introduce new sections and organize content.

core/image.name: Image
core/image.description: Insert an image to make a visual statement.

core/video.name: Video
core/video.description: Embed a video from your media library or upload a new one.

core/embed.name: Embed
core/embed.description: Embed videos, images, tweets, audio, and other content from external services.

core/list.name: List
core/list.description: Create a bulleted or numbered list.

convertToOrdered: Click ordered list button in toolbar

core/button.name: Button
core/button.description: Prompt visitors to take action with a button-style link.

core/columns.name: Columns
core/columns.description: Display content in multiple columns. One of the most effective blocks for complex layouts.

insert: Choose column layout (e.g., two equal, 30/70, three equal)
buildLayout: Add Columns block and select layout
In first column: add Heading, Paragraph, and other content
In second column: add Image or Gallery
Select parent Columns block in List View
Change alignment to Wide width in toolbar
styleColumns: Add padding around the block's content
duplicateColumn: Select that column in List View

tips: Build and style one column completely, then duplicate it for consistency
Use List View to easily select the parent Columns block
Center text and set image aspect ratios for uniform appearance

core/gallery.name: Gallery
core/gallery.description: Display multiple images in a rich gallery.

core/cover.name: Cover
core/cover.description: Add an image or video with a text overlay. Great for headers, banners, and hero sections.

createHeroBanner: Select background image from media library
Select both text and button, use Stack block to group
Change Cover alignment to wide or full width
styleOverlay: Lower opacity (e.g., 30%) to make image more visible
Higher opacity for better text readability
adjustSize: Use toolbar to toggle full height
Or drag the bottom handle to adjust height manually
Deselect 'Inner blocks use content width' for full-width nested content

tips: Use Stack block inside Cover to group and center content
Adjust overlay opacity for balance between image visibility and text readability
Don't forget to add URL to call-to-action buttons

core/media-text.name: Media & Text
core/media-text.description: Set media and words side-by-side for a richer layout. Perfect for featured content with call-to-action.

insert: Add image on one side from media library
Add content on the other side
createFeatureSection: Select image from media library for left side
On right side: add Heading block
Make button text bold and add URL
adjustLayout: Select the Media & Text block in List View
Change alignment to wide width in toolbar
Use toolbar button to flip media to right side
Change vertical alignment to align bottom

tips: Great for 'About' sections with image and description
Adjust media width for visual balance
Always add URL to call-to-action buttons

core/table.name: Table
core/table.description: Insert a table for sharing data.

core/separator.name: Separator
core/separator.description: Create a break between ideas or sections with a horizontal separator.

core/spacer.name: Spacer
core/spacer.description: Add white space between blocks and customize its height.

insert: Drag handle or set height in sidebar

core/code.name: Code
core/code.description: Display code snippets that respect your spacing and tabs.

core/group.name: Group
core/group.description: Combine blocks into a group for styling and layout.

groupExisting: Select multiple blocks (Shift+click in List View)
Click three dots in toolbar or use toolbar Group button
addBackgroundColor: Choose a color or add custom color
changeWidth: First, deselect 'Inner blocks use content width' in Settings
Then use toolbar to select Wide width or Full width

tips: Use Group to apply background colors to sections
Rename groups to organize your page structure
Must deselect 'Inner blocks use content width' before changing alignment

core/row.name: Row
core/row.description: Arrange blocks horizontally in a row with flexible alignment options.

insert: Add blocks that will appear side by side
fromGroup: Click block icon in toolbar to Transform

tips: Use Row for horizontal arrangements like icon + text
Great for navigation items or social links

core/stack.name: Stack
core/stack.description: Arrange blocks vertically with consistent spacing.

insert: Add blocks that will stack vertically
centerContent: Use toolbar to justify items to center

tips: Use Stack inside Cover blocks to center content
Customize spacing between stacked items in sidebar

inserter.description: The block inserter panel for adding new blocks

toolbar.description: The block toolbar that appears above selected blocks

sidebar.description: The settings sidebar on the right

topBar.description: The top toolbar with save and settings

editorCanvas.description: The main editing area (may be in iframe)

openInserter.description: Open the block inserter to add new blocks
steps: Click the + button in the top toolbar or between blocks

searchBlocks.description: Search for a specific block type
steps: Type block name in search field

selectBlock.description: Select a block to edit it
steps: Click on the block in the editor canvas

deleteBlock.description: Remove a block from the post

duplicateBlock.description: Create a copy of a block

transformBlock.description: Convert a block to a different type
steps: Click the block icon in toolbar
